trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Snikch has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Snikch has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of Snikch's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Snikch surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During his first turn, Snikch has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit Snikch scores against a {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Snikch is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Snikch instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Once per turn, Snikch deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Snikch that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Snikch doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Cunning, Quick & Hidden
entries: Snikch can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of his turns and has advantage on initiative rolls.
Additionally Snikch has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide if there are at least two allied creatures within 15 feet of him, or if he is in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Snikch's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: The Cloak of Shadows
entries: While wearing this cloak, Snikch is {@condition invisible} to any creature more than 30 feet away from him.

Additionally any creature who targets Snikch with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This effect doesn't protect Snikch from area effects, such as the explosion of a {@spell fireball}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Snikch fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Bands of Power (1/Day)
entries: Snikch can use his bonus action to activate his Bands of power. Until the start of his next turn he gains a +5 bonus to his Strength score and may add his Strength modifier as well as his Dexterity modifier to the damage rolls for his weapon attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Snikch makes five melee attacks, one with his bite, and four with his weeping blades; or it makes three ranged attacks with his warpstone stars.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Weeping Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Warpstone Stars
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d4 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Snikch adds 6 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him as a reaction. To do so, Snikch must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The skaven has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the skaven's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the skaven surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes three melee attacks, one with its bite and two with its shortsword.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Whip

action.name: Poison Bomb

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The skaven adds 2 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the skaven must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The tumour host explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 20 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and become infected with a disease on a failed save. Creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition are immune to this disease. The disease invades an infected creature's system, killing the creature in a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d12} + the creature's Constitution score, unless the disease is removed. In half that time the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} for the rest of the duration.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes two attacks with its greatclub.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Weaponry
entries: The skaven is armed with either a plague scythe, plague flail, or a plague maul.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skaven is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Plague Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Plague Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Plague Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Pestilent Breath {@recharge}
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 15 ({@damage 6d4}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. The {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the skaven surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Weaponry
entries: The skaven is armed with either a two-handed weapon, two one-handed weapons, or a one-handed weapon and a shield from the choices in its actions. Additionally it also has a tail-blade and a warplock pistol.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes five melee attacks, one with its bite and three with its chosen weaponry and one with its tail-blade; or it makes two ranged attacks with either its poison bombs or warplock pistol.

action.name: Bite

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Warplock Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) lightning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The skaven adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the skaven must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Frenzied Madness
entries: Due to the skaven's maddened nature it is incapable of using objects.

Additionally if the skaven has taken damage since the end of its last turn, it must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of its turn. The DC equals 5, or 1/4 of the total damage its taken since the end of its previous turn, whichever number is higher. On a failed save, the skaven must move directly towards the nearest creature and use the multiattack action against it. If there is more than one possible target, the DM chooses the target. The skaven then regains control of itself for the remainder of its turn.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the skaven can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Horrific Appearance
entries: Each creature that can see the skaven must succeed a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of it's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes three attacks; one with its bite, one with its blade-graft and one slam.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The skaven has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the skaven's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Curse of the Horned Rat (1/Day)
entries: The skaven may cast the spell {@spell curse of the horned rat|FFSkaven}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skaven is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five melee attacks with its doomglaive.

action.name: Doomglaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the skaven's choice that is within 120 feet of the skaven and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the skaven's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Pestilent Breath {@recharge}
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 25 ({@damage 10d4}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. The {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

action.name: Curse of the Horned Rat (1/Day)
entries: The skaven may cast the spell {@spell curse of the horned rat|FFSkaven}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the skaven can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Surprise Attack

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The skaven has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the skaven's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the skaven fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skaven is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Queek has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Queek has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Queek surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Warpstone Armour
entries: Queek wears armour encrusted with shards of pure warpstone, which protect him from harm and strike at potential attackers.

Once per turn, when a creature within 5 feet of Queek misses him with a melee attack, they must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: The Foul Pendant
entries: Queek gains a +2 bonus to his AC and saving throws (included above) while wearing The Foul Pendant.

trait.name: Hatred (Dwarves, Goblins, Orcs)
entries: Queek has advantage on the first melee attack roll he makes on his turn against any Dwarves, Goblins or Orcs.

trait.name: Dwarf-Gouger
entries: This weapon gives a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls (included below).
Additionally Queek gains an additional +5 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon against {@race Dwarf|PHB|Dwarves}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Queek fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Queek makes five melee attacks, one with its bite two with his longsword and two with Dwarf Gouger.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Dwarf-Gouger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Queek adds 4 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit him as a reaction. To do so, Queek must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Snat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Snat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Snat surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Cunning
entries: Snat can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When Snat uses the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost him extra movement on that turn. When he makes a melee attack against a creature, he doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether he hits or not.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Snat makes four melee attacks, one with his bite, two with his scimitar of the horned rat and one with his tail-blade.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Scimitar of the Horned Rat
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tail-Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Pestilent Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 15 ({@damage 6d4}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. The {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.
Snat is cowardly and will run when the tide turns but is otherwise a vicious fighter when he has the advantage.
Also very prone to holding grudges, notable even amongst other Skaven.
Self preservation above all else; he will flee from a fight if the Skaven in charge is killed or if he is reduced to below half his maximum hit points.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Snat halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. Snat must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Throl has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Throl has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of Throl's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Throl surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: Throl can use his bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. He regains the use of this trait after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Relentless
entries: If Throl takes 14 damage or less that would reduce him to 0 hit points, he is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If Throl moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with his bastard sword on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Throl makes three melee attacks, one with its bite and two with its bastard sword.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Bastard Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.
"Dont D'Undying"
Notes:
- Has a horrific scar on the side of his face that exposes the bone of his skull.
- Usually sticks with Telk Keenfang as his melee bodyguard.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Telk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Telk has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Telk's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Telk surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Telk can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

trait.name: Horde Breaker
entries: Once on each of his turns when Telk makes a weapon attack, he can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of his weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Telk makes three attacks, one with his bite and two with his longbow or shortsword.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.
"Enriqu Von Shooty-Bowman"
Notes:
- Particularly cruel, will typically target the weakest or most vulnerable enemy
- Usually sticks with Throl Nightjaw as his ranged support

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Telk is a 2nd-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The skaven has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the skaven's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the skaven surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes three melee attacks, one with its bite and two with its glaive.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

entries: The skaven adds 2 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the skaven must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The skaven has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the skaven's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the skaven surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes three melee attacks, one with its bite and two with its longsword.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The skaven adds 2 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the skaven must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Ska has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Ska has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Ska surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Ska hits with it.

trait.name: Loyal Lackey
entries: Ska has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ska makes three melee attacks, one with his bite and two with his adamantine bearded axe.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Adamantine Bearded Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands. Whenever Ska hits an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

action.name: Poison Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Ska adds 3 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him as a reaction. To do so, Ska must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The skaven has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the skaven's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the skaven surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the skaven has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the skaven scores against a {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the skaven is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the skaven instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Once per turn, the skaven deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the skaven that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the skaven doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The skaven can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes four melee attacks, one with its bite, one with its shortsword, one with its claw gauntlet and one with its tail-blade; or it makes two ranged attacks with its throwing daggers.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

action.name: Claw Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail-Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Throwing Daggers
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The skaven adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the skaven must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The rat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the rat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Diseased Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the skaven plague rat to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the skaven plague rat drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Diseased Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skaven has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The skaven has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the skaven's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the skaven surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skaven makes three melee attacks, one with its bite and two with its shortsword.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Warplock Jezzail
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/240 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) lightning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Firing Position (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Skaven plants a small wooden barricade into the ground and rests their Jezzail on it for greater accuracy. Until the Skaven moves they gain a +2 bonus to their AC and to attack rolls made with their Warplock Jezzail.

spell.name: Bless with Filth
entries: You touch a nonmagical weapon, imbuing it with noxious poisons.
Until the spell ends, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} poison damage to any target hit by the weapon. If the weapon isn't magical, it becomes a magic weapon for the spell's duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Curse of the Horned Rat
entries: {@i With a sickening lurch, the fabric of reality is torn by the twisting power of the Horned Rat, allowing his children to spill forth from the rift and transforming your foes.}
Choose up to {@dice 3d6} non-{@creature skaven|FFSkaven} creatures and unoccupied spaces you can see within range.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Each chosen creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage; a creature that is reduced to 25 or less hit points by this damage is transformed into a {@creature skaven|FFSkaven}. The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the {@creature skaven|FFSkaven|skaven's} statistics, including its alignment and personality. This change can only be reverted by a {@spell Wish} spell.
On a successful save the creature takes half as much damage and isn't transformed if reduced to 25 or less hit points.
This spell has no effect on a shapechanger, a creature with 0 hit points or on creatures with the Immutable Form trait.

entries.name: Unoccupied Spaces
entries: A {@creature skaven|FFSkaven} appears in the unoccupied space. A summoned {@creature skaven|FFSkaven} disappears when it drops to 0 hit points

The {@creature skaven|FFSkaven} are hostile to all non-{@creature skaven|FFSkaven} creatures, which may include you. Roll initiative for the summoned {@creature skaven|FFSkaven} as a group, which has its own turns. The {@creature skaven|FFSkaven} pursue and attack the nearest non-{@creature skaven|FFSkaven} to the best of their ability.

spell.name: Warpstorm
entries: {@i You summon a sudden storm of green and black lightning that is formed of pure arcane energy, its deadly bolts striking your foes.}

Choose a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d6} lightning damage and {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

Additionally a creature who takes 10 or more necrotic damage from this spell must make a Constitution saving throw; on a failed save they become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

components.m: a copper likeness of the horned rat

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the lightning and necrotic damage both increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Flensing Ruin
entries: Three green ribbons of warpstone-derived energy tear the flesh from the target's bones.
Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage and {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional bolt for each slot level above 2nd.

components.m: a piece of tanned skin from a human, elf or dwarf

spell.name: Death Frenzy
entries: {@i Gesticulating wildly, you gift creatures with a rabid and frothing urge to close in, attack, and consume.}

Choose a number of willing creatures you can see up to your spellcasting modifier. Until the spell ends, the targets may use their bonus action to make an additional weapon attack when they make a weapon attack on their turn.
However they also take {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, at the end of each of their turns.

components.m: two drops of blood from a rabid animal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, a target may make two attacks with their bonus action instead of one and the necrotic damage increases to {@damage 4d10}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, a target may make three attacks with their bonus action instead of one and the necrotic damage increases to {@damage 6d10}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, a target may make four attacks with their bonus action instead of one and the necrotic damage increases to {@damage 8d10}.

spell.name: Howling Warpgale
entries: {@i You gesture twitchingly to the skies and fierce hurricane gales begin to build, swirling around you and making flight impossible.}
A strong wind (40 miles per hour) blows around you in a 15-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you. The wind lasts for the spell's duration.
The wind has the following effects:

items: It {@condition deafened||deafens} you and other creatures in its area.
It extinguishes unprotected flames in its area that are torch-sized or smaller.
It hedges out vapor, gas, and fog that can be dispersed by strong wind.
The area is {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|3} for creatures other than you.
The attack rolls of ranged weapon attacks have disadvantage if the attacks pass in or out of the wind.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed a Strength saving throw of be knocked {@condition prone}. A flying creature has disadvantage on this saving throw.
Creatures within the radius are considered lightly obscured.

spell.name: Crack's Call
entries: {@i With the arcane incantation invoked, you cast the spell by stamping your foot, causing the very ground to split asunder.}
The ground in a line 60 feet long and 15 feet wide splits open, creating a chasm up to 40 feet deep. The area within the chasm becomes difficult terrain.

Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage, becomes {@condition prone} and falls to the bottom of the chasm. On a successful save the creature does no fall {@condition prone} and moves to the nearest space not occupied by the chasm.

spell.name: Scorch
entries: {@i You thrust your hands into the ground while chittering fiery incantations, causing a great gout of green flame to burst forth.}

Choose a point on the ground you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered around that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures gain no benefit from cover, except full cover, against this spell. A target takes {@damage 2d12} fire damage and {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

Additionally a creature who takes 10 or more fire damage from this spell must also make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, it must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Warp Lightning
entries: A bolt of greenish-black lightning arcs toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armour made of metal.

The spell creates more than one bolt when you reach higher levels: two bolts at 5th level, three bolts at 11th level, and four bolts at 17th level. You can direct the bolts at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each bolt.

spell.name: Ghostly Flame
entries: You conjure a small blob of glowing, green fire out of thin air that drips viscous fluid as it burns. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.
This spell's fire and necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d4} each when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4} each), 11th level ({@damage 3d4} each), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4} each).

spell.name: Rat Thrall

m.text: a bit of mouldy cheese, which the spell consumes

entries: You gain the service of a {@creature rat} thrall. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the thrall has the statistics of a {@creature rat}.
Your thrall acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn.
When the thrall drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form and it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.
Until this spell ends you are able to comprehend and verbally communicate with the thrall for the duration as if you share a language.

spell.name: Vector
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against diseases for 1 minute.
This spell's duration increases when you reach certain levels: 10 minutes at 5th level, 1 hour at 11th level, and 8 hours at 17th level.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: One creature of your choice you can see within range experiences a jolt of searing pain and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.
This spell's psychic and necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d4} each when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4} each), 11th level ({@damage 3d4} each), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4} each).

spell.name: Weeping World Sores
entries: {@i At your wretched word, the world itself begins to bubble and boil with toxic pus.}

Choose a point on the ground you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius hemisphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage and {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Vermintide
entries: A great swarm of rats erupts from you in a line 60 feet long and 15 feet wide in a direction you choose. Make a melee spell attack against each creature in the line, on a hit the target takes {@damage 5d6} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wither
entries: {@i With dark chanting you cast a spell of wasting, shrinking sickness and corrosion.}

Choose one target within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, until the spell ends the target's Constitution score is reduced by 3 and their movement speed is halved. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. The decrease to the target's Constitution also decreases its maximum hit points, the amount it decreases by is also removed from its current hit points; this lasts until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cloud of Corruption
entries: {@i You release a stinking blast of diseased fury.}

Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.
A {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Plague
entries: {@i You unleash a vile disease that scours the battlefield in search of victims to infect.}

Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
Then, roll on the following table:

rows.name: Backfire!
entries: The nearest creature to the current target that is friendly to you (including yourself) and within range becomes the new target of the spell and it must a Constitution saving throw as if it was the original target of the spell.
If there is more than one possible target, the DM chooses between the targets. If there are no valid targets within range, the spell ends.
Then, roll on this table again.

rows.name: Dissipate
entries: The spell ends with no further effect.

rows.name: Spread!
entries: The nearest creature to the current target that is hostile to you and within range becomes the new target of the spell and it must a Constitution saving throw as if it was the original target of the spell.
If there is more than one possible target, you choose between the targets. If there are no valid targets within range, the spell ends.
Then, roll on this table again.
A creature can only be the target of this spell once each time it is cast.

components.m: a sprinkling of several dead fleas

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Favour

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw with advantage

entries: {@i You steal the fortune of others and use it for your own gain.}
The triggering creature gains disadvantage on the roll, negating its advantage.
You then gain advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make within 1 minute. You can be empowered by only one use of this spell at a time.

components.m: a bit of flesh from a humanoid creature

spell.name: Pestilent Breath
entries: You exhale a pestilent, poisonous cloud at your enemies. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes {@damage 8d4} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. The {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

components.m: a stick of warpstone incense lit at both ends

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, each target takes {@damage 2d4} extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 3rd.

item.name: Poison Bomb
entries: A crude vessel containing a noxious, poisonous liquid. As an action, you can throw this bomb up to 20 feet, or up to 60 feet with disadvantage, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the poison bomb as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and if the target is a creature it must succeed a DC 13 Consitution Saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: The Foul Pendant
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this pendant.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you are {@condition poisoned} until the curse ends. Additionally for every 24 hours that elapse while you are {@condition poisoned} your hit point maximum is reduced by {@damage 1d4}. This reduction lasts until the curse ends; you die if your hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

item.name: Warpstone Armour
entries: A strange suit of armour encrusted with shards of pure warpstone, which protect the wearer from harm and strike at potential attackers.

Once per turn, when a creature within 5 feet misses you with a melee attack, they must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} lightning damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed. Wearing it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you are {@condition poisoned} until the curse ends. Additionally for every 24 hours that elapse while you are {@condition poisoned} your hit point maximum is reduced by {@damage 1d4}. This reduction lasts until the curse ends; you die if your hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

item.name: Dwarf-Gouger
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally you gain a further +5 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon against {@race Dwarf|PHB|Dwarves}.

item.name: Scimitar of the Horned Rat
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage on a hit.

item.name: Bands of Power
entries: While attuned to the bands you may use your bonus action to activate them. Until the start of your next turn you gain a +5 bonus to your Strength score and you may add your Strength and Dexterity modifiers to the damage rolls for your weapon attacks if they don't already include them.
Once used, the bands can't be activated again until the next dawn.

item.name: The Cloak of Shadows
entries: While attuned to and wearing this cloak, you are {@condition invisible} to any creature more than 30 feet away from you.

Additionally any creature who targets you with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This effect doesn't protect you from area effects, such as the explosion of a {@spell fireball|PHB}.

item.name: Weeping Blades
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d6} poison damage on a hit.

entries.name: Special
entries: You can draw and throw up to 3 warpstone stars as part of an attack when you take the attack action; for each thrown above the first you add an additional damage die to the slashing damage.
This weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d6} poison damage on a hit.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage on a hit.
Additionally this weapon is volatile, when it misfires you take {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage on a hit.
Additionally this weapon is volatile, when it misfires you take {@damage 2d8} lightning damage and {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.

entries.name: Capacity
entries: A weapon's capacity is the number of shots it can hold at one time. When a weapon has been fired a number of times equal to its capacity, it must be reloaded before firing again.

entries.name: Reload
entries: Reloading a weapon replaces your next attack you would make with the weapon, refilling the ammunition in the weapon up to its capacity. If you prefer, you may instead use an action to reload your weapon.

entries.name: Misfire
entries: If your natural roll for a ranged attack falls at or below the misfire score of the firearm you are using, you suffer a misfire. Your attack misses, any ammo you used in the attack is expended, and your firearm becomes broken. You must repair a broken firearm before using it.
If you don't need to make a ranged attack roll when firing a weapon with a misfire score, roll a d20 to determine if it misfires.

entries.name: Broken
entries: A broken firearm cannot be fired until it is repaired. To repair a broken firearm, you may use an action to attempt a tinker's tools ability check with a DC equal to 10 plus the weapon's base misfire score. On a success, the weapon is no longer considered broken.
